channel.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
channel.description:
Okay, so here's my problem! When I go to my webclient the character's head comes out bobbling and glitchy, along with his feet missing. Not only this but his name at the bottom (where you type) come's out as a long and random name. Also, since I am owner, I find too that I cannot type in any emote commands because of some sort of glitch problem. But I find that there are no problems when I go directly to my client file and click to play. This problem is tripping me out and I need someone to please help me!
Additional info: I'm using a 317 client. I got the client from "combattscape" download.

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

maybe you jarred and signed it wrong?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zaxiva zaxiva
item.description:
@zaxiva wrote:

Did you read the above? I was already jaring and signing, so whether it had to do with character encoding or not didn’t really make a difference had I not done that Kinda threw me off with that.

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @Tobbescape Tobbescape
item.description:
@Tobbescape wrote:

judostar1:

I’m sure that it may be the character encoding. Or you might not have jared your client.

You have to jar and sign to make a webclient lol

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @zaxiva zaxiva
item.description:
@zaxiva wrote:

I Don’t think it has to do with character encoding because emotes do not work on the website server, and usernames are a bit funky. Unless emotes coincide with characters? Also it works perfectly fine when going directly onto my file webclient, so it makes more sense that it would be cache permitting to this issue. Any thoughts on this would be helpful, also I still need help finding jarsigner.exe file??!

Read full topic
item.source: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

Its not the clache…
It must be something wrong in the character encoding.

Read full topic
item.source: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @zaxiva zaxiva
item.description:
@zaxiva wrote:

Oh, that’s good to take notice, maybe if I can’t figure this out i’ll search for some cheat clients, if you know of any. Anyays I went about jaring my client using this youtube vid: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CiDQ7igB6fk and go to 3:40. That’s when I got stuck. I went into the file but when I went into the bin folder, the jarsigner.exe wasn’t there. In fact, no files were in the bin folder. Is there a step that I was suppose to have taken, or is this just not compatable with my server???

Read full topic
item.source: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @Decronix Decronix
item.description:
@Decronix wrote:

If you are using a IP changing webclient, or client, that error will occer.
Sometimes, cheat clients, have better loaded graphics, and show the heads better, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @nsfpure nsfpure
item.description:
@nsfpure wrote:

[quote=“Tobbescape, post:6, topic:399784”][quote author=zaxiva link=topic=496903.msg3633345#msg3633345 date=1308417695]
I’m a bit new at this, and i’m not sure how to go about "jar"ing my client… Could you please give me some instructions? I appreciate all the help, btw. And apart from using a “no ip” host and rs ps webclient maker, I don’t have a website if that creates for a problem…
[/quote]
Youtube it. “How to jar and sign”[/quote]

there is a link to a very good jarring youtube video on ric’s tut. search ric’s webclient on this forum =)

Read full topic

item.title: My Private server webclient has glitchy problems!?
item.dc:creator: @ApocalypseX ApocalypseX
item.description:
@ApocalypseX wrote:

zaxiva:

Alright, but how would I go about loading the cache correctly then? I used Rs Ps website to create a client…

In that case, you have to jar the CLIENT that you have downloaded and click “Play”, and upload it to your site. A RS-PS webclient maker only works for some sources.
